urls.title: COVID-19: Clinical features - UpToDate
urls.description: Coronaviruses are important human and animal pathogens. At the end of 2019, a novel coronavirus was identified as the cause of a cluster of pneumonia cases in W

data.text:
@guyopt1 @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin @LittleMoiz A rolling 7-day-average is a common way to present noisy data, and it represents the daily data. So we see here infections (green) vs severe (red).

The ratios of severity were previously reported to ~80% mild, 15% severe, 5% critical and 2.3% case fatility rate. -> https://t.co/bP2pQkpIA7

data.text: @yuvharpaz @StavKislev @AArgoetti @eshed_lin @LittleMoiz i don't understand the 15% of cases deterioration into severe cases? its mostly 2% of cases that goes into severe, the chart is wrong since it divides by 7 the 7 days moving average which is already a daily average..

data.text:
@StavKislev @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin @LittleMoiz That’s great to see!
I think the use of the word “obvious” in this context of observational data is not accurate though.

text:
@StavKislev @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin @LittleMoiz That’s great to see!
I think the use of the word “obvious” in this context of observational data is not accurate though.

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin If the hospitals didn't break at 400 ICU patients in Feb, then they won't break with 200 now. Still hospital capacity is a legit concern, and plan to augment capacity was 18 months too late.

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin If the hospitals didn't break at 400 ICU patients in Feb, then they won't break with 200 now. Still hospital capacity is a legit concern, and plan to augment capacity was 18 months too late.

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin It is very labor intensive to care for a corona patient when they get to ICU. Israeli hospitals were overcrowded before the pandemic. I have read there are 17k acute beds (not incl geriatric) and only ~800 total ICU beds (there is some flex capacity).

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin It is very labor intensive to care for a corona patient when they get to ICU. Israeli hospitals were overcrowded before the pandemic. I have read there are 17k acute beds (not incl geriatric) and only ~800 total ICU beds (there is some flex capacity).

data.text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin IDK, but the first thing that comes to mind is the overall strain of the wards and the ICUs. In Israel the background stress is off the charts, and the higher the workload, the higher the mortality. Also, could be unique characteristics of the Cyprus population (e.g. age..)

text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin IDK, but the first thing that comes to mind is the overall strain of the wards and the ICUs. In Israel the background stress is off the charts, and the higher the workload, the higher the mortality. Also, could be unique characteristics of the Cyprus population (e.g. age..)

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Sometimes impossible to compare countries as well. Is it plausible that Cyprus had 3x as many in ICU but a radically lower % died? Or are there different definitions of what constitutes ICU? https://t.co/JztedBcGw9

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Sometimes impossible to compare countries as well. Is it plausible that Cyprus had 3x as many in ICU but a radically lower % died? Or are there different definitions of what constitutes ICU? https://t.co/JztedBcGw9

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin What is also full of confounders is the vaccinated vs. unvaccinated population (much higher % haredi, arab, low SES - tends toward worse overall health). So I am sticking to macro level statistics. Virus has changed as well. Hard to do counterfactual.

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin What is also full of confounders is the vaccinated vs. unvaccinated population (much higher % haredi, arab, low SES - tends toward worse overall health). So I am sticking to macro level statistics. Virus has changed as well. Hard to do counterfactual.

data.text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin I think that this is a nice presentation, but it's confounded. We don't know who deteriorated into the ICU. Could by unvaccinated, or vaccinees who responded poorly (a minority). The vaccines greatly reduce post infection consequences, so I prefer the infection/severe comparison

text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin I think that this is a nice presentation, but it's confounded. We don't know who deteriorated into the ICU. Could by unvaccinated, or vaccinees who responded poorly (a minority). The vaccines greatly reduce post infection consequences, so I prefer the infection/severe comparison

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Previous peaks in this graph were fairly close to case peaks, so directionally cases do relay information.

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin I think something like this is far more meaningful imho. I would measure case fatality as deaths/hospitalized. https://t.co/CqAUwc4n9V

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin I think something like this is far more meaningful imho. I would measure case fatality as deaths/hospitalized. https://t.co/CqAUwc4n9V

data.text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin For death. In israel the case fatality rate was ~0.7% of infected. Currently went down below 0.3%. Globally it has been reported to ~2.3%, but it incorporates older populations and overrun health care facilities. So far our healthcare system managed to stay strong.. barely

text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin For death. In israel the case fatality rate was ~0.7% of infected. Currently went down below 0.3%. Globally it has been reported to ~2.3%, but it incorporates older populations and overrun health care facilities. So far our healthcare system managed to stay strong.. barely

data.text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin There were previous cohorts that demonstrated low unrecognised infections. The large scale serological campaign was bizzare from the very beginning, and the results were consistent as expected. Anyway, the severe cases is a reliable metric, and similar trend is also observed for-

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Is there really robust serological testing? There could have been for young children but it was cancelled. Who gets tested also changed after vaccination/green pass. Prob most meaningful metrics now are # in ICU (home care altered hospitalizations) and ofc deaths.

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Is there really robust serological testing? There could have been for young children but it was cancelled. Who gets tested also changed after vaccination/green pass. Prob most meaningful metrics now are # in ICU (home care altered hospitalizations) and ofc deaths.

data.text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Robust serological testing here, with extremely high rates of qPCR tests, show that there is very little unidentified spreading of the virus - marking these results as similar to the ground truth.

text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Robust serological testing here, with extremely high rates of qPCR tests, show that there is very little unidentified spreading of the virus - marking these results as similar to the ground truth.

data.text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin It all comes down to the question of ground truth vs test identification. 15% severe cases has been observed globally from day 1 of the pandemic, and the data in Israel has been rather consistent with it. The *ONLY* divergence from that rule was seen AFTER vaccine deployment.

text: @SKmacro @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin It all comes down to the question of ground truth vs test identification. 15% severe cases has been observed globally from day 1 of the pandemic, and the data in Israel has been rather consistent with it. The *ONLY* divergence from that rule was seen AFTER vaccine deployment.

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Stav, when the number of cases is something one can influence via testing volume, measuring 'severe-COVID' against it is of little meaning.

text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin Stav, when the number of cases is something one can influence via testing volume, measuring 'severe-COVID' against it is of little meaning.

data.text: @StavKislev @LittleMoiz @yuvharpaz @AArgoetti @eshed_lin So we can forget about the promised 94% to 80% efficiency!
